intro: Hieracium furcilliferum, commonly known as the forked hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium furcilliferum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
